documents.document: @antonio_lanza But not really a downside as the politicians know they need to work together. Ridiculous Trudeau abandoned this. Signed!
@antonio_lanza End result is more fair gov. Small parties have a chance. Downside is you almost always have minority governments
@antonio_lanza MPs are in either because they won a riding or because they got enough votes so were selected from party's "list"
@antonio_lanza Done! I'm a CND in New Zealand and they long abolished FPTP here. Instead you got two votes: for local candidate and party
I ran a 1.5 HR session on IT/coding/robotics for the teachers at my daughter's school. Scratch was a hit but HTML as a bit intimidating
Govt puts up $270k to help young women into tech sector careers https://t.co/qukq0MGRqe #bizEDGE NZ #Innovation #NZTech #Women in technology
@bcnzer the next morning the 1st thing I see on TV is Trump press conference & him claiming credit for Republican party hacking defense ugh
Within minutes of getting into my taxi, the driver starts talking about Trump. As a non American this is the last thing I want to discuss
@nzregs I recently had a 'driveless' (and uninsured) vehicle drive into my garage door and truck. Garage door had to be completely replaced
Interesting article. Keen to try Aurelia with Typescript for my next SPA https://t.co/mcTKop5TKZ
I'm looking forward to the day when I can purge all memories of https://t.co/e28Vc1gJ4d syntax. They creeping into my C# code
Confessions of a Dev late to Unit Testing https://t.co/YtrQhm7anc

@bcnzer And I also answered my first question on Stack Overflow. Feels nice being able to volunteer my time and share (what little) I know
My first PR got merged and now I can see my username in the code, as the last change to the source. So cool!
The PR functionality in #VSTS is very nice. I like how it makes full use of screen real-estate. I just wish VSTS had a dark theme...
Discovered the #Resharper rename function (in ASP .NET Core) changed a bunch of unrelated cshtml when I changed a field name in a .cs. Yikes
@bcnzer Cool pic. Really stoked with this. Tried to tell other, non-technical people but they just didn't get it https://t.co/YaW8EsjShY
@nigelsampson Thanks - I was almost sick with worry that I would screw it up!
I submitted my first ever PR *and* it was to the #ASP Core documentation, to update a sample project #dotnetcore
@HannesN that works well. I created a wrapper class + interface (for ASP Core DI). I encountered this problem 3 times last night!
I love unit tests and mocks but I hate having to work around static (extension) methods in other libraries

People ask me where I think I'll be in three years, but I don't know.
It's not like I have 2020 vision.
Setting up Moq with your .NET Core test project https://t.co/A0ASLl8SkI
@bcnzer If not you'll get a file IO exception. I spent far more time than I should have trying to figure this one out... 😥
If you're using Moq in your ASP Core xUnit test project make sure to remember to add "System.Diagnostics.TraceSource": "4.0.0"
I can go to sleep happy... all my unit tests pass again!
Last night I was watching @pluralsight videos, before going to bed. All night I dreamt about what I learned. That's one way to retain info!
Time for some delicate surgery to fix my helicopter https://t.co/VMyQrvuqR3
